Dear Mr. MULVANY:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
1/16/20. Due to the violations, a written corrective action plan is required. The corrective
action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or MSA citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, a regular certificate of inspection
license will be issued. If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan,
disciplinary action will result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (269) 337-5289.

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the
following:
R 400.10187 Housing population; rated capacity.
The population in housing or living units shall not exceed the
rated capacity.
The facility was over capacity by 1 resident on 17 days during the last review period.
R 400.10529 Sprinkler systems.
(2) All required sprinkler systems shall be inspected and
tested and all other maintenance performed as specified in
the national fire protection association pamphlet no. 13A,
1981, entitled "Care and Maintenance of Sprinkler
Systems," at least once a year by a sprinkler contractor.
The licensee shall maintain documentation of the last
inspection and test.
The QFI indicated the facility had deficiencies when the sprinkler system was
inspected. Those deficiencies have now been corrected. A CAP is still required in
order to show how the facility will continue to ensure compliance.
R 400.10535 Means of egress.
(3) In multistory secure and large facilities, at least 1 means of
egress from each floor shall be direct to the outside or shall be
through an enclosed stairway which is properly separated from
floors below and which exits directly to the outside at grade or
through a previously approved escape window.
The facility has one stairway to the second floor bedrooms. This facility has been
approved every year since the facility was first licensed in 1992 by the previous QFI.
It is recommended that the facility request a variance to the rule from the
department.
R 400.10537 Stairways, halls, corridors, and aisles.
(2) In all new and converted large and secure facilities,
stairways shall be enclosed with materials that have at least the
fire-resistance rating specified by the national fire protection
association pamphlet no. 220, 1979, for the type of construction.
4

All other vertical openings through floors shall be fire-stopped
with like materials.
The stairway and hall to the second floor bedrooms are not enclosed by walls but it
is a loft style with a railing. This facility has been approved every year since the
facility was first licensed in 1992 by the previous QFI. It is recommended that the
facility request a variance to the rule from the department.
2.) This is a court operated facility that does not have a contract with the Department
of Health and Human Services.
3.) This is a court operated facility that does not service the plaintiff class covered by
the Implementation, Sustainability, and Exit Plan (ISEP).
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility did not require technical assistance at this time.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility did not require consultation at this time.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
The facility has not been required to submit any corrective action plans this licensing
period.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is
recommended that the facility will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
